notesStmt.note: Fragmentary all throughout. Defective at the beginning and at the end. Many leaves more or less mutilated. Gaps after folios: 1, 2, 8, 9, 17, 25, 27, 45, 55, 111, 131. Stained.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Three pieces of Yaʻqūb ibn Isḥāq Qirqisānī Kitāb al-Anwār wal-marāqib.

msItem.title: Kitāb al-Anwār wal-marāqib كتاب الأنوار والمراقب

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each. Quires numbered in part 1, i.e. nos. 13, 14, 15, 16.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Three different Arabic hands of the 12 to 13th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Abu Yusuf Al-Kirkisani. Sefer Mitsvoth. Sect. XI, XII. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 2578.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, inscribed folio [21v].
